item.title: You Can Now Pre-Order Your Very Own A Minecraft Movie Chicken Jockey Action Figure and Plush | SDCC 2025
item.content:encoded:
You can get your first look at these exclusive figures in Microsoft's booth #435 at SDCC!

Sure, A Minecraft Movie made nearly $1 billion at the global box office, but one of the biggest things to come out of the film was undoubtedly the reactions to the Chicken Jockey scene. Now, you can pre-order your very own action figure and plush of the iconic zombie and chicken duo and get a first look at them if you happen to be at San Diego Comic-Con.

Mattel's two new Minecraft exclusives - the Minecraft Movie Chicken Jockey Large Scale Action Figure and Minecraft Zombie Chicken Jockey Plush - made their big debut at SDCC and those in attendance this weekend can see them in person by stopping by Microsoft's booth #435.

If you aren't able to make it, you can pre-order the Minecraft Movie Chicken Jockey Large Scale Action Figure at Entertainment Earth or BigBadToyStore for $34.99 and the Minecraft Zombie Chicken Jockey Plush for $14.99 at Amazon or Walmart!

As for the figures, the official descriptions are as follows;

Minecraft Movie Chicken Jockey Large Scale Action Figure ($34.99)

Relive the iconic 'Chicken Jockey' scene from A Minecraft Movie with this large-scale action figure! The Baby Zombie figure features swappable face plates and multiple points of articulation to recreate your favorite scenes and poses from the film. The Chicken figure features an articulated mouth and wings and comes with a clear saddle to secure the baby zombie figure. Made with a soft goods shirt, the Baby Zombie figure stands about 7-inches tall and the Chicken figure stands about 5 1/4-inches tall. Seated, the figure set stands about 9-inches tall in total.

Minecraft Zombie Chicken Jockey Plush ($14.99)

Minecraft fans can create snuggles and stories with plush figures inspired by favorite characters from the video game universe! The Zombie Chicken Jockey is 8 inches tall and made with a mix of premium fabrics, making it fun to hold and cuddle. Pixelated details give it the extra element of collectability! The Chicken Jockey Minecraft plush makes a fun video-themed gift for kids and collectors ages 3 years old and up.

For more, check out the Chicken Jockey Easter Egg you can now find in Minecraft, our review of A Minecraft Movie, and all the details of IGN's big SDCC liveshow featuring Project Hail Mary, King of the Hill, Peacemaker, and more.

Adam Bankhurst is a writer for IGN. You can follow him on X/Twitter @AdamBankhurst, Instagram, and TikTok, and listen to his show, Talking Disney Magic.

Originally posted:

Jul 25, 2025 4:29 pm

item.title: These Are the Cards Magic: The Gathering Players Want From Edge of Eternities
item.content:encoded:
The latest Magic: The Gathering set, Edge of Eternities, kicks off in pre-release today, but if you’re wondering which cards from the new set are worth keeping an eye out for, we’ve got you covered.

From spaceships to planets, this new sci-fi universe is a stark departure even in a year that’s included Aetherdrift, Tarkir, and Final Fantasy, and early impressions seem to be positive.

To clarify, these are the best-selling Edge of Eternities cards so far, thanks to data from TCGPlayer, but these aren’t competitive recommendations. We’ll likely have to see how the set shakes out over the next fortnight or so for that.

It’s also worth stressing that these are based on pre-launch prices, so expect major fluctuations.

With that covered, here are the best-selling Magic: The Gathering cards of Edge of Eternities so far.

Keep an eye out for these Edge of Eternities cards

Magic: The Gathering Thrumming Hivepool

Sliver deck fans, your time has come. Thrumming Hivepool is currently the best-selling card of Edge of Eternities according to TCGPlayer, with a price of around $20. It’s cheap if you have a bunch of Slivers handy, powers them up, and adds even more Slivers.

Magic: The Gathering Cosmogoyf

That’s followed by Cosmogoyf, which gains power for the number of exiled cards you have, meaning it could get out of hand.

Magic: The Gathering Terrasymbiosis

Terrasymbiosis can only be used once per turn, but you can turn counters into card draw. It could be scary in the Counter Blitz Final Fantasy precon.

Magic: The Gathering Tannuk, Memorial Ensign

Tannuk, Memorial Ensign is fourth on the best-sellers list, and is the only uncommon card you’ll find here. He’s an aggressive little blighter, dishing out damage when you drop land and potentially turning that to card advantage, too.

Magic: The Gathering Singularity Rupture

Number 5 is Singularity Rupture, a board wipe and then some. It destroys all creatures, then mills half the deck of as many players as you choose.

Magic: The Gathering Breeding Pool

Breeding Pool is the first of two lands in the top 10, tapping for Green or Blue, but you’ll have to pay life if you don’t want it to enter tapped.

Magic: The Gathering The Eternity Elevator

It’s taken until number 7, but we finally have our first Spacecraft. These are part of a new mechanic, and can be used as your Commander. We’ve already got a list of some great candidates for that, but The Eternity Elevator is an interesting one because it’s basically just a big mana engine that won’t do anything in combat. Still, we can see the appeal in putting it in your deck.

Magic: The Gathering Tezzeret, Cruel Captain

Tezzeret, Cruel Captain is up next, and he’s the only Planeswalker on this list. He’s all about using artifacts to power him up before spreading that love to creatures or finding even more of them.

Magic: The Gathering Sacred Foundry

Sacred Foundry is the second land in the top 10, and is the Red/White option for the aforementioned Breeding Pool.

Magic: The Gathering Exalted Sunborn

Rounding out the top 10 most-purchased cards in Edge of Eternities is Exalted Sunborn, a flying Angel Wizard with lifelink that gives you a touch of the Doubling Season effect of double tokens. It can also be Warped, meaning you can cast it for less, exile it at the end of the turn, and then summon it back later.

So, there you have it, the most popular cards of Edge of Eternities so far. Which ones are you considering for your deck? Let us know!

Lloyd Coombes is an experienced freelancer in tech, gaming and fitness seen at Polygon, Eurogamer, Macworld, TechRadar and many more. He's a big fan of Magic: The Gathering and other collectible card games, much to his wife's dismay.

Originally posted:

Jul 25, 2025 4:00 pm



https://www.ign.com/articles/best-selling-edge-of-eternities-cards-magic-the-gathering

item.title: Nintendo Confirms Mario and Peach's Relationship: They're 'Good Friends'
item.content:encoded:
You ever wake up and think it'll be a normal day only to discover that literally everything you thought you knew about reality is wrong? That's what happened to me today when I woke up, sat down to work, and then read a post stating that Mario and Peach are apparently "good friends" as opposed to, I dunno, anything else I might have thought they were to one another.

"Princess Peach and Mario are good friends and help each other out whenever they can."

Via: Nintendo Today app. pic.twitter.com/IsyQqe2KLz

— Kābī (@KirPinkFury) July 23, 2025

This aggravating discovery comes from the Nintendo Today app. The post that originally included this information is now gone due to the app's regularly updating, but has since been preserved in several spots including by Twitter user @KirPinkFury, who originally surfaced it online. The post, which was a profile on Princess Peach, included the sentence, "Princess Peach and Mario are good friends and help each other out whenever they can." Good friends, you say? What about all those times they definitely smooched?

"Look," you might say, "they could be good friends and in a relationship. It's important to be friends with the person you love also." Sure, you're correct. But who's describing a relationship like that? I don't go around referring to my husband as my "good friend". That would probably confuse several people, including him! The only conclusion I can come to here is that Nintendo is trying to distance Mario and Peach from the previous very, very, very direct ways in which it indicated they were, at minimum, romantically interested.

Nintendo admittedly has been deeply inconsistent about this over the years. Peach has been referred to as Mario's "special someone," they've been shown on multiple occasions to have some level of romantic interest in one another. Nintendo's Yoshiaki Koizumi has directly said in an interview before that Mario "carries a torch" for Peach. Nintendo celebrated them as a romantic couple, pink hearts and all, for Valentine's Day at least once. And Mario even tried to propose to her at the end of Super Mario Odyssey. Though she refused at the time, she had also just gone through a wild ordeal with Bowser where he tried to kidnap her and force her into marrying him. If I had just been kidnapped into an attempted forced marriage and then rescued and my boyfriend tried to propose to me the second I was rescued, I'd probably tell him to take a hike too.

But whatever! I guess they're just friends or something. Just like Link and Zelda, two characters who live together and definitely sleep in the same bed. Next they're going to try and tell me there's nothing going on between all those people in Fire Emblem.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. You can find her posting on BlueSky @duckvalentine.bsky.social. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

In This Article



https://www.ign.com/articles/nintendo-confirms-mario-and-peachs-relationship-theyre-good-friends

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Finally Gets Its Two-Player Duos Mode on July 30
item.content:encoded:
Everyone who's wanted to run through Elden Ring Nightreign with just their trusted duos partner is getting their wish. FromSoftware confirmed today that a two-player Duo Expeditions mode will arrive in Elden Ring Nightreign Patch 1.02.

The patch will arrive on July 30, allowing just two Nightfarers to embark on expeditions to strike down the Nightlords together. Before now, the only options were to either head out on a solo expedition or team up with two others for a trio.

Duos has been a hotly requested feature, as it there seems to be a solid contingent of players who'd like to play with just one other person. Elden Ring Nightreign director Junya Ishizaki previously said the two-player mode was something that was "overlooked" during development.

In the wake of Elden Ring Nightreign's launch, FromSoftware committed to adding Duo Expeditions as a mode. And now, several weeks later, the option is finally ready. I imagine this should be a nice option for playing with your pals and loved ones, without the need to add a random third to the mix.

Patch 1.02 also brings a few other updates in the quality-of-life department, including more filtering options for your Relic pool. Considering players probably have a hefty amount of Relics at this point (hopefully not too many), the added sorting options should be nice too.

The eager duos and everyone else queuing up will have some tough fights ahead of them too, as the next Everdark cycle spins up at the end of July. Tricephalos, Augur, Equilibrious Beast, and the Fissure in the Fog are all set to receive their enhanced Everdark Sovereign fights starting July 31. Solos, duos, and trios alike should have a good time learning these bouts, if the past few Everdark Sovereigns are any indication.

It's good to see this particular playstyle finally get accomodated, and considering it's been a little under two months since Nightreign launched, it didn't take that long either. It's certainly been intriguing to watch FromSoftware work on a live service-oriented game like Elden Ring Nightreign, and considering the potential for DLC down the road, I'm betting there's still more to see in the Lands Between.

We’ve got plenty of Nightreign tips and tricks to help you take down all the eight Nightlord Bosses, and if you’re wondering how to unlock the two locked Nightfarer Classes, check out How to Unlock the Revenant and How to Unlock the Duchess, plus How to Change Characters.

Eric is a freelance writer for IGN.

In This Article



https://www.ign.com/articles/elden-ring-nightreign-finally-gets-its-two-player-duos-mode-on-july-30
